stream_context.summary: Kaze planned and blocked out Course 14, a cardboard-and-crafts themed world, while live-modeling props (toilet-paper-roll mushrooms, cardboard fences, crayons, etc.), mapping non-linear paths, and repeatedly testing performance on real N64 hardware.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 will mimic a child’s cardboard diorama; every surface must read as a familiar craft material (cardboard, gift-wrap, glue, stapler needles, crayons, toilet-paper rolls).
Kaze redrew the level’s critical paths in Blender, moving the spawn point to the centre and ensuring at least two routes to each star so the stage is "not linear" like early drafts.
development_findings.quote: This is very similar to the layout in Peach’s Fury and that one was really not linear.

development_findings.summary: A paper airplane will act as a moving platform/teleporter from the main island to a ‘bit-pipe’ side area.
Glue patches will shorten Mario’s jump, tilt-bridges will be cardboard sheets pinned with toothpicks, and a toilet-paper-roll half will form a slide, adding mechanical variety tied to materials.
Kaze created a new mushroom platform: a toilet-paper roll trunk with gift-wrap cap and 3-D stapler needle; he hand-built the shader to add a subtle reflective sheen.
development_findings.quote: Dude, the toilet paper roll is too good. I can’t not do this.

development_findings.summary: Technical test on real N64 showed 18 ms RSP and 36.8 ms RDP time; overdraw is the main bottleneck, polygon count roughly 4 k so far.
development_findings.quote: That means it’s all the overdraw.

development_findings.summary: Saved 30 RSP instructions in GraphRender by caching GMAT stack indices and plans to swap GMAT_STACK_INDEX for GMAT_STACK_ADD for a further ~20-instruction gain.
development_findings.quote: I saved 30 instructions on Graph Render today which is very exciting.

development_findings.summary: Nemio emulator displays colours closer to intended saturation than Project 64; Kaze uses SummerCart for instant ROM uploads (seconds vs 40 s on EverDrive).
A limited public demo containing only Course 1 is planned "soon".

context_findings.summary: Kaze is self-employed; streaming will slow because he is returning to contract work.
context_findings.quote: I’m self-employed… I’m soon back to work, so I’m going to be able to stream a lot less.

context_findings.summary: He received about $3,500 from SimpleFlips but cannot invoice without an address, showing informal finances.
context_findings.quote: I can’t write an invoice to him because he didn’t give me his address.

context_findings.summary: Wants to diversify YouTube output with simple, high-appeal videos (e.g., BLJ explained) to generate "easy content" and revenue.
Shows pride in hardware optimisation and worries about players finding the game either too easy or too hard.
context_findings.quote: Do you guys actually think that people will complain that the game is too easy?

context_findings.summary: Personal aside: installed an automatic lawnmower and jokes about "becoming a boomer."

zeina.summary: Zeina appeared in chat; Kaze refers to her as "chat mom," indicating light community-management involvement.
zeina.quote: Zeina’s gonna be the chat mom now.

key_stories.title: GraphRender Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: While chasing higher framerates on real N64, Kaze discovered a way to cache matrix-stack indices, trimming 30 instructions and planning further savings.
key_stories.challenge: Course 14’s test build ran below 50 FPS due to RSP load.
key_stories.process: Reviewed GraphRender loops, inlined functions, used the restrict keyword, and cached GMAT stack values.
key_stories.outcome: RSP time dropped, bringing hardware speed back to ~50 FPS and giving headroom for more geometry.
key_stories.key_quote: I saved 30 instructions on Graph Render today which is very exciting.

key_stories.title: Toilet-Paper Mushroom Prop
key_stories.summary: Needing vertical platforms that match the craft theme, Kaze brainstormed with chat and built a mushroom using a toilet-paper roll, gift-wrap, and a stapler needle.
key_stories.challenge: Flat cardboard terrain felt dull and lacked recognisable landmarks.
key_stories.process: Searched reference images, created a tiling toilet-paper texture, modeled a 3-D staple, and wrote a custom sheen shader.
key_stories.outcome: A distinctive, low-poly platform that fits the aesthetic and doubles as a gameplay element.
key_stories.key_quote: The toilet paper roll is too good. I can’t not do this.

key_stories.title: Non-Linear Path Revision
key_stories.summary: Early greybox felt like a straight line; Kaze redrew routes and added branching sections so every collectible can be reached by multiple strategies.
key_stories.challenge: Chat noted the course "looked very linear."
key_stories.process: Moved spawn, overlaid 'painted' path guides in Blender, inserted side loops (crayon platforms, pin jumps, paper-airplane transfer).
key_stories.outcome: Level now mirrors Peach’s Fury philosophy with at least two paths per objective.
key_stories.key_quote: There should be a way to go this way as well—and to go up here.

key_stories.title: Overdraw Bottleneck Identified
key_stories.summary: Performance dip on hardware traced to excessive overdraw from large, uncut background planes.
key_stories.challenge: RDP time measured at 36.8 ms, exceeding budget.
key_stories.process: Profiled on SummerCart and Nemio, compared RSP/RDP times, visually inspected un-culled geometry.
key_stories.outcome: Plan to cut hidden faces and lower fill-rate, which should restore full framerate.
